details.equipment: pellet press (23 mm diameter, ~5 mm thickness)

details.temperature: 700 °C for 24 h, 600 °C for 24 h, 500 °C for 48 h

techniques.name: Raman Spectroscopy
techniques.parameters: Excitation wavelength: 532 nm, laser power: 1 mW, duration: 720 s

challenge.description: Presence of Li2MnO3 impurities in samples with x ≥ 0.75.
challenge.impact: The impurities are electrochemically inactive, leading to a significant reduction in the rechargeable capacity (Qrech) and energy density (W).

solution.description: Optimization of the Co/Mn ratio to x = 0.5, which avoids the formation of Li2MnO3 impurities.
solution.methodology: Systematic variation of x in the LiCoxMn2−xO4 composition and structural analysis using XRD and Raman spectroscopy.
solution.effectiveness: Highly effective, as the x = 0.5 composition achieved the maximum energy density (W = 627 mWh·g−1) and avoided impurity formation.

evidence.source: Sections discussing structural analysis and electrochemical performance (Figures 3, 4, and 6).
evidence.data: XRD patterns showed no Li2MnO3 phase for x = 0.5, and the energy density was maximized at this composition.

context.material_properties: Spinel structure with high energy density and reduced lattice volume change during charge-discharge cycles.
context.experimental_conditions: Samples synthesized using a two-step solid-state reaction technique with controlled heating and cooling rates.
context.application_relevance: Critical for developing high-energy-density positive electrode materials for lithium-ion batteries.

challenge.description: Decrease in discharge capacity (Qdis) at higher Co content (x = 1).
challenge.impact: The reduced capacity limits the material's effectiveness as a high-energy-density electrode.

solution.description: Identification of x = 0.5 as the optimal composition to balance capacity and energy density.
solution.methodology: Electrochemical testing of various compositions (0 ≤ x ≤ 1) to determine the relationship between Co content and performance.
solution.effectiveness: Effective, as x = 0.5 provided the highest energy density and a broad maximum in discharge capacity.

evidence.data: Discharge capacity (Qdis) for x = 0.5 was 140 mAh·g−1, higher than that for x = 1 (108 mAh·g−1).

context.material_properties: Electrochemical performance depends on the balance between Co and Mn redox reactions.
context.experimental_conditions: Cells operated at 25°C with a voltage range of 3.0–5.4 V and a current of 0.6 mA.
context.application_relevance: Ensures the material's suitability for high-performance lithium-ion batteries.

challenge.description: Increase in Li2MnO3 impurity content with higher sintering temperatures for x = 1.
challenge.impact: Higher impurity levels reduce the electrochemical activity and discharge capacity of the material.

solution.description: Optimization of sintering temperature to 1000°C for x = 1 to minimize impurity formation.
solution.methodology: Comparison of samples sintered at 1000°C and 1100°C using XRD and electrochemical measurements.
solution.effectiveness: Partially effective, as the impurity content was reduced but not eliminated at 1000°C.

evidence.source: Sections on synthesis and structural analysis (Figures 4 and S2).
evidence.data: XRD patterns showed reduced Li2MnO3 content at 1000°C compared to 1100°C, with corresponding improvements in discharge capacity.

context.material_properties: High-temperature stability and phase purity are critical for electrochemical performance.
context.experimental_conditions: Sintering conducted under flowing oxygen with controlled heating and cooling rates.
context.application_relevance: Ensures the material's viability for use in high-energy-density lithium-ion batteries.
